title: 1964 RHD 21 Window Samba Deluxe For Sale - Mint Condition

posts.content:
Reduced Asking Price: £60,000
Sensible offers will be considered

It is time for us to find a new home for Daphne, our beautiful 21 window Samba. The restoration was started many years ago, by a previous owner, and completed in 2012 by VW Kampers, West Sussex. There are 22787 miles on the clock, but we have done just 1600 miles in around 3 years, since the full rebuild was completed. I'm not the most technically minded VW owner so here's a spec sheet that I've been keeping up-to-date during our ownership. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions.

Glenn Broadway
glennbroadway@gmail.com
07917403040

Featured in VW Camper & Bus, January 2013
Professional 100 point nut & bolt restoration.
Blasted and rust proofed shell.
Painted full shell to include underside, engine bay, inside. Painted on rotisserie.

ENGINE:
1776cc Built by JH Engines.
22787 miles on the clock (we have done just 1600 miles in the 3 years since this rebuild was completed).
New crank tested case and heads ported for 90.5mm barrels.
Hemi-cut combustion chambers to give standard compression.
8 dowel flywheel to crankshaft.
Con rods matched for weight.
Stainless Steel exhaust valves.
New distributer drive gear & cam gear.
Bosch 009 distributer.
Double thrust cam bearings.
Engle 110 cam.
New oil pump.
Twin 34ict single choke weber carburettors.
Petronix Electronic ignition and coil.
New alternator, fan tinware etc etc.
Full flow oil system.

RUNNING GEAR AND TRIM:
Creative Engineering IRS set-up.
Rebuilt brakes all round, detailed underside.
Creative Engineering adjustable front beam.
Creative Engineering front Safari windows.
Creative Engineering Deluxe body trims, in Stainless Steel.
Creative Engineering rear vent trim in Stainless steel.
New chassis ‘belly pans’ colour coded.
Stainless steel front and rear bumpers.
Stainless steel Exhaust .
All new braking system including CSP front disc kit (no servo).
Spax Adjustable Shocks all round.
Vintage Speed gear shifter.
All new Schofield rubber seals.
New 12v wiring loom.
Working deluxe clock in dash.
New headlining and sunroof cover.
Lowered all round.
SSP Polished Crest alloys with Yoko tires.

INTERIOR:
Full Van Wurkz interior in Birch wood ply with matching bulk head with wine rack, kick panel and matching fridge panel.
Billet Alloy and Oak steering with Wolfsburg Crest.
Rock and Roll bed.
Buddy Seat in cream and red leather, removable.
Stainless Steel table leg with matching birch wood ply top.
Van Wurkz Overhead locker with table storage.
Interior includes Wealco compressor fridge, smev stainless steel cooker and sink with pumped water.
Electric management system.
Mains electrics and also high amp leisure battery.
Propex underfloor heater HS2211.
Full leather interior panel set in English cream and red hide.
Full leather upholstery set in English Cream and Red Hide.
Deep red curtain set with table cloth and matching table cloths.
Full panel insulation to include sound deadening and wool lining.
Red and Cream tiled flooring.
Mad Matz carpet set in the front.
Leather Kick Panels.
Chrome mirrors and door locks and catches.



















Full imgur gallery: http://imgur.com/a/TnqSl

Yes this will do me nicely but sadly can't reach the price unless I sell one of the Mrs kidneys, I'm sure my new bus will come along soon as 6 months now without and I can't keep this money much longer, it has to go.
Fantastic wish i could stretch my budget. Glws

one horny bus !

sorry for my reaction, but closer to perfection would be hard to achive,
any forum members who can give me a 60.000 pound loan ?
I can get to the Mid 40s but that's with a bank loan

What a great ad!
That's the standard others should follow. Great description,great pictures and a fair price.
Nice bus! But for 100 point resto, where is belly pans?! Or it's only me beeing picky?

george21 wrote:Nice bus! But for 100 point resto, where is belly pans?! Or it's only me beeing picky?

Bolt on i reckon.
The belly pans are there... But that photograph wouldn't have been very interesting with them in place!
But do they bolt on or off?????
I actually don't know what that means?! I've never taken them off...

Someone must have put them on to take them off otherwise how were they off for the photo and not on, if they are off they are off but if they are on they are on but in the photo they are off,,,,,so where is the bolts ? That is perhaps not the Question, more importantly where are the pans and who took them off ?

It looks like there are some riv bolts, as against riv nuts, in the rails and cross members. They might be riv nuts though

Presumably the belly pans go on and are secured with some nuts or bolts.

But they are definitely OFF in the photo

Lovely looking bus all the same

Hi Glenn
Pay no attention to the belly pan frolics, at least it keeps your post at the top, awesomely lovely bus and GLWS.

REGARDS

Ron
